page.title: 08Historic Features,Footpaths
page.content: Large parts of this area have no road access but parts of the footpath system are perhaps the oldest visible features here.There are several routes which were more important than they are today.The north- south route may possibly have been a London to York road, and early parish maps show a road along the western boundary now scarcely visible in a field.A route from Stagsden to North Crawley via Stagsden West End is today marked by a hedgerow and change of level and "The Ridgeway", which may be prehistoric, runs along the ridge top which forms most of Stagsden's parish boundary- from Bromham to Cranfield.
